entry.title: It’s all the squirrels fault
entry.summary:
Author: alienspronkles

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,209Chapters: 1/5Kudos: 0

Summary: When one domino falls, the rest follow. Years ago Buck was a Navy SEAL but left. After that, he moved to Los Angeles and became a firefighter. Now in the present, more dominos fall when Buck sees a squirrel, wins the lottery, and then gets recruited by Lieutenant Commander Steve McGarrett to hunt down the man who killed his father.Featuring but not limited to: Buck having PTSD, Eddie being jealous about Buck being in Hawaii with another man, and Grant-Nash-Buckley trivia night.

entry.title: Nine Lives, One Closet
entry.summary:
Author: Cryptocol

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 45,964Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 171

Summary: Eddie Diaz has a secret. Not the “in love with Buck” one (though, sure, that’s festering too). No, this one comes with fur, whiskers, and an unsettling eagerness to use his shifted form for petty psychological warfare.Because Buck? He’s afraid of cats. Something about “the staring” and “they’re plotting to steal my soul”. Eddie, being the picture of maturity, reacts by shifting into a cat and showing up everywhere. Buck’s door. The firehouse. His balcony. In his laundry. Just…watching.Eddie is thriving. Chris is an evil mastermind. And Buck spirals, convinced the cat is haunting him, gifting him presents, and slowly gnawing at his sanity. This is not a pet-owner dynamic. This is a hostage situation with emotional manipulation from a four-legged gremlin.Everything’s flawless - until Eddie forgets he’s not supposed to be naked in Buck’s apartment. At least, not like that.Oops.

entry.title: When The Past Comes Knocking
entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,056Chapters: 2/3Kudos: 25

Summary: After three years of almost-but-not-quite, Buck and Eddie finally admit they’re in love.Then Abby — Buck’s first love — returns to LA, working alongside Maddie and slowly reinserting herself into the 118 family.Eddie’s insecurities spiral, jealousy flares, and heartbreak looms. Buck is clueless. The 118 is supportive. And somewhere in the chaos, Eddie has to learn that he is more than enough — and that love isn’t a competition.

entry.title: The man I buried, the man I found.
entry.summary:
Author: Noasshowaddiction

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,875Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 42

Summary: Evan Buckley buried the love of his life years ago. Eddie Diaz’s death was the wound Buck never recovered from—the folded flag, the funeral, the medals pressed into his hands were all he had left.Except Eddie isn’t dead.When Eddie walks into the 118 as their newest firefighter, Buck’s world comes crashing down all over again. Grief collides with longing, fury with love, and suddenly Buck is forced to face the man he mourned, the man who promised he’d come back, and the man who let him believe he never would.Working side by side should be impossible. Pretending they’re just coworkers is unbearable. And when secrets, old promises, and new dangers come to light, Buck has to decide whether the man he buried is the same one he’s found—or if some ghosts can never be forgiven.

entry.title: Just Ask Josh
entry.summary:
Author: Madforyou

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,986Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 291

Summary: Chim is reading aloud before Buck can lunge across the counter and stop him, “I’d beg so loud they’d all know exactly what you—” His eyebrows climb to his hairline, “Buck, what the fuck?”Ravi bursts out laughing, nearly doubling over, “Wait, you sexted the group chat?!”“No, no, no—” Buck’s voice traitorously cracks and he can feel the heat in his face, “That’s not—I didn’t—”Hen’s tone sharpens, amusement undercut with curiosity, “You’re seeing someone? Who is she?”Or,Three months of secret hookups with Eddie and Buck manages to blow it all with one wrong text.

entry.title: what's waiting out there (we can never know)
entry.summary:
Author: Rehearsal_Dweller

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 69,715Chapters: 9/13Kudos: 1,404

Summary: Hen stares at Buck for a long moment, then turns on her heel to walk upstairs. “Chim! Did you know that Peanut is a human child and not a small animal?” “Buck’s Peanut?” Chim calls back, leaning over the railing. “No? Is she not a dog?” “No!” Buck replies. “She’s a preschooler!”  OR: At 22, Buck got one of his hookups pregnant and decided to keep the baby himself rather than let her be put up for adoption. At 26, he joined the 118. You know the rest, right?
